items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- The Tesla robo taxi experience offered a *smooth ride*, contrasting with the more *jerky navigation* of the Whimo vehicle. 
- A significant concern arose during a *left turn attempt*, where the vehicle stopped in the intersection, requiring engineer intervention. 
- Overall, the ride was *mostly uneventful*, although minor hiccups occurred, highlighting the need for ongoing improvements in *autonomous driving technology*.

items.title: Electric Era CEO Quincy Edmund Lee on EV Charging
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- Quincy Edmund Lee, CEO of Electric Era, discusses the rapid growth of EV charging stations, developing them in just *54 days*.
- With a focus on *reliability* and *user experience*, Electric Era is aimed at making EV charging *affordable* and *convenient*.
- Quincy emphasizes the importance of charging infrastructure for EV adoption, likening it to the need for gas stations in the gasoline era.

items.title: Polished or Perplexing? Hyundai IONIQ 9 Interior Review
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- The *2026 Hyundai IONIQ 9* features an *expensive* interior for $80,000, including many individual components that seem overdone. 
- The overall *design execution* is praised, but questions arise about whether materials align with the high price point. 
- While the vehicle's *features and utility* are significant, there's a noticeable lack of cohesiveness in the material quality compared to its cost.

items.title: What’s Under the Hyundai IONIQ 9? Full Review
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- The **2026 Hyundai IONIQ 9** is a notable three-row BEV priced around *$79,000*.
- Unique **styling features** include a bold square theme and segmented LED lighting, potentially aimed at cost savings.
- Engineering observations highlight the structural design and **safety features**, including advanced crumple zones and aluminum bumpers, enhancing crash performance.

items.title: Ricky Roy on Electric Vehicles & Content Creation
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- Ricky Roy, creator of *Two Bit da Vinci*, discusses bridging technical content with a general audience. 
- The conversation highlights the evolving nature of electric vehicle (EV) technology and brand competition. 
- Roy emphasizes the challenges and strategies in content creation while navigating the fast-paced media landscape.

items.title: 2025 Mini Countryman SE ALL4 Interior Review
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- The 2025 Mini Countryman has a *classic Mini style* but isn't as small as expected. 
- Attention to *detail* in the design includes unique materials and decorative elements throughout the interior. 
- Though comfortable, the vehicle's design leads to concerns about *practicality and comfort*, especially with seat height and cleanliness of fabrics.

items.title: Exclusive Tour of Slate Auto’s Beta EV Factory
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- This video showcases a tour of Slate Auto’s **Beta EV Factory** with CEO Chris Barman and head engineer Eric Kyper. 
- Slate aims to produce affordable, customizable electric vehicles that can be easily modified from one model type to another, appealing to *DIY enthusiasts*. 
- The discussion highlights how hands-on demonstrations helped secure investor confidence, particularly with support from prominent backers like **Jeff Bezos**.

items.title: The Powertrain of the Future – Conifer’s Vision
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- Conifer Motors focuses on manufacturing *electric powertrains*, emphasizing innovative and inexpensive designs targeted at under 30 horsepower.
- The company aims to revolutionize electric motor manufacturing by utilizing readily available *ferrite* magnets to match the torque of traditional rare earth magnet motors.
- Their approach combines manufacturing process innovation with design, enabling *lower-cost production* and adaptability for various motor types, potentially disrupting the industry.

items.title: Drones, Defense, & Demos: The Companies Protecting American Airways
2025 MINI Countryman SE ALL4 Review
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- The **2025 MINI Countryman SE ALL4** offers *308 horsepower* from dual motors and is notable for its *agile* performance.  
- Inside, features include a *recycled fabric* interior and a *user-friendly infotainment system* accessible via steering controls.  
- However, it has downsides such as limited *range* (up to 212 miles), which may not suit drivers with longer commutes.

items.title: Serve Robotics CEO Ali Kashani on Automating Food Delivery
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- Serve Robotics, founded by Ali Kashani after a spin-off from Uber/Postmates, builds autonomous delivery robots operating in cities like Los Angeles, Miami, and Dallas, already completing deliveries from 1,500 restaurants.
- Their robots use *embodied AI* to navigate unpredictable urban environments, handling obstacles like uneven sidewalks and even unexpected events such as goats on sidewalks, achieving 99.8% delivery reliability—much higher than human drivers.
- The company aims to reduce delivery costs from about $10 to $1 by automating last-mile delivery, leveraging AI both for real-time navigation and for off-robot decision-making, while anticipating further integration of generative AI and advanced models as technology evolves.

items.title: 2025 MINI Countryman SE ALL4 Hoist Review
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- The *2025 MINI Countryman SE ALL4* is built on the UKL platform and is the heaviest Mini ever at around 4,500 pounds.
- It features innovative parts consolidation typical of German engineering, enhancing *safety and repairability* through smart design choices.
- The vehicle integrates design elements that focus on efficient energy management during crashes while maintaining *agility and interior space*.

items.title: New and Improved? Refreshed Model Y Interior Review
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- The **2026 Tesla Model Y** features new exterior styling and enhanced *suspension* systems, significantly improving ride comfort.
- Key changes include **upgraded seats**, cooling features, and *new shifting technology* for easier driving.
- Despite a familiar overall shape, the vehicle's **interior refinement** and material quality are at par with more expensive models, like the Model S.

items.title: Inside Redwood Materials: Tour & JB Straubel Interview
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- The visit to *Redwood Materials* showcases their innovative battery recycling processes. 
- JB Straubel discusses how they handle different types of batteries and the importance of reusability. 
- The facility aims to minimize CO2 emissions while effectively managing battery waste and recovery.

items.title: Skywell EV Battery Pack Teardown – What’s Inside?
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- The **Skywell battery pack** is a **72 kWh** system weighing approximately **442 kg** and offers a range of about **400-450 km**.
- The teardown reveals **modular design** featuring cooling plates and a **Battery Management System (BMS)** for monitoring cell voltages.
- Important components include contactors, shunts, and bus bars connected in series, impacting both efficiency and safety during operation.

items.title: The Secret Behind Electric Motors: Inverter Explained
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- The **inverter** converts DC from batteries into AC for motor operation. 
- Key components include a control board, switches, and capacitors to manage energy flow and efficiency. 
- Efficiency is high (up to **99%**), but thermal management remains critical due to heat production.

items.title: 24M: The Next Level of American Battery Technology
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- 24M showcases groundbreaking battery tech with *660 watts/kg* energy density.
- Their *Impervio separator* enhances safety by preventing dendrite formation, crucial for applications like automotive and defense.
- The company emphasizes *American ingenuity*, aiming to exceed traditional manufacturing standards for reliability and performance.

items.title: Importance of Rare Earth Materials in Electric Motor Magnets
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- Heavy *rare earth materials* are crucial for producing neodymium magnets, used in motors and various electronic devices.
- Restrictions on their export by China highlighted their economic significance, affecting global trade dynamics.
- To enhance neodymium magnets for high temperatures, *dysprosium* and *terbium*, also *heavy rare earth elements*, are included to improve stability and performance.
